sub_title: Creator & Founder @ Lyre's Non-Alcoholic Spirits Co. | Founder & NED @ BrandLink Group | Angel & Advisor | FMCG\CPG Nerd
summary:
Serial, multi-award winning entrepreneur and founder of a portfolio of businesses in the FMCG / CPG sector, including marketing and advertising, logistics and fulfilment, print and merchandise production.  He has recruited and led high-performing executive teams across several businesses from foundation to multi-million dollar annual revenues and award-winning standing in their respective industries.

In 2019, created and founded now the world's largest, most widely available and most valuable non-alcoholic spirits company, Lyre's Spirit Co.  Lyre's products have secured no less than 300 international wine and spirits awards in the first three years of availability and the prestigious non-alcoholic producer of the year in the New York Spirits Competition and a 2021 Spirited Award from the Tales of the Cocktail Foundation.

Mark's background experience is marketing focused and bridges the client / agency divide, bringing a thorough understanding of marketing strategy development and brand commercialisation for the FMCG / CPG industry.

Additionally, has a deep understanding of fulfilment, logistics, international procurement, freight and eCommerce, which has been paramount to success of two businesses within his portfolio, including recognition by the ORIAS in 2020 with the International Conqueror award, the AFR Fast100 for a record-equalling four consecutive years (2016 - 2019), the Deloitte Tech50 awards in 2017 - 2019, the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Asia Pacific in 2017 - 2019, the Smart50 awards in 2017 & 2018 and claiming the Transport & Logistics business of the year in the Optus myBusiness Awards in 2018.

An active Angel and Advisor, Mark's focus is on pre-seed and seed stage companies where he can leverage experience and networks to assist and accelerate commercialisation.  His portfolio of investments include a spread of industries including Finance, Logistics, Education, Biotechnology, HR, Food & Beverage, Marketing & Creative, Fashion, FMCG and Luxury Consumer Goods with all sharing a commonality of strong technology focus and innovative edge.

In 2018, Mark was nominated and progressed to the EY Entrepreneur of the Year Award Finals for Australia and also in 2021 & 2022 for The Grocer Gold awards for Entrepreneur of the Year and in 2022 as a Great British Entrepreneur of the Year Finalist. 

Mark proudly serves the community on multiple advisory boards, is the Chairperson and Founding Board Member of ANBA North America and UK&EU, is a Director of the Aussie Founders Network and a YPO member.

awards.title: Spirited Award - Tales of the Cocktail Foundation
awards.description: The most coveted award in the Spirits World.  Lyre's Italian Orange picked up the 'Spirited Award' for Best New Spirit or Cocktail Ingredient, Globally.  This is the first time in history that a non-alcoholic product has been awarded this auspicious accolade.

awards.title: The Grocer Gold Awards - Entrepreneur of the Year - Finalist
Drinks Business & Spirits Business - Global Masters Spring Blind Tasting Awards - 2 x Master Medals, 19 Medals Total
awards.description:
Lyre's secured no less than 19 medals including two Taste Master accolades.

Despite more brands entering the no and low category than ever before, the Lyre’s Aperitif Dry was awarded the first of two Taste Masters, a second awarded to Lyre’s Amalfi Spritz (our ready-to-drink cocktail) designed for the world to enjoy a non-alcoholic version of the most loved Spritz.

Lyre’s also picked up 11 x gold and 6 x silver medals.

awards.title: ORIAS 2021 - International Conquerer Award
awards.description: The Australia Post Online Retail Industry Awards is the original industry event that celebrates all that is truly good and inspiring among the top performers in Australian ecommerce.

awards.title: Power Retail All Star Awards - Top Emerging Online Retailer 2022
No & Low Masters - Taste Master - 4 x Master Medals, 5 x Gold Medals, 8 x Silver Medals
awards.description:
As well as receiving the ultimate accolade for Taste Master at the competition, we won additional medals including:

4 x MASTER medals – Coffee Originale, Amaretti, Aperitif Rosso and Italian Spritz (Taste Master)

5 x GOLD medals – Italian Orange, Aperitif Dry, Orange Sec, White Cane Spirit and Classico RTD

8 x SILVER medals – G&T, Dark n Spicy, Amalfi Spritz, Absinthe, Spiced Cane, Dark Cane, Pink London and Agave Blanco (the newest edition to our portfolio)

awards.title: Bevnet - Annual Best New Product Award - Lyre's RTD Range
awards.description:
The winners of BevNET’s Best of 2021 Awards embody that spirit and drive, combining inspiration with effort, style, dynamism and personality. Backed by the confidence and enthusiasm from having these brands, products and leaders at the helm, the beverage industry is ready for whatever surprises 2022 might have in store.

What the judges said:

"Lyre’s premixed spirits perfectly execute a non-alcoholic take on traditional cocktail recipes with combinations ranging from an Amalfi Spritz to its innovative and limited-edition Dark & Spicy beverage. These “impossibly crafted” cocktails hold their own among the likes of non-alcoholic and alcoholic RTD cocktails with a distinct yet contemporary twist on buzz-worthy beverages, without the booze. As report after report continues to predict that non-alcoholic spirits are going to continue their climb within the beverage industry throughout the next year, Lyre’s core line of RTD alt-cocktails are definitely one to watch."

awards.title: Dot Digital Awards 2021 - Best in APAC, Inspiring Responsible Marketing Campaign, Outstanding Email Creative
Pause Fest Awards 2021 - Hammer Award and Underground Award
awards.description: The Pause Awards honour Australia's most impactful and innovative companies.  Lyre's received two awards, including the Underground Award – For early stage mavericks and the Hammer Award – For nailing it.

awards.title: IWSC - Spring Tasting Masters
awards.description: We are thrilled with our performance at the IWSC spirits awards Autumn Masters this year, with the Lyre's Spirit Co portfolio collecting 14 additional medals, bring us to now more than 300 international wine & spirit competition accolades.

awards.title: DBSB Autum Tasting - Master Awards - 15 Medals
awards.description:
DBSB Autumn Tasting 2021 awards. Lyre's Spirit Co is incredibly proud to be recognised with another 15 medals.

Competition to find and reward the best drinks brands on the world stage was fierce with entries doubling. Despite the increased competition Lyre’s received the highest awards with 2 x Master medals for Italian Orange and Italian Spritz. This followed with 6 x Gold and 7 x Silver medals.
awards.issuer: The Drinks Business & The Spirits Business

awards.title: Interbrand - Breakthrough Brand Award
awards.description:
Interbrand announced Top 10 'Breakthrough Brands' for 2021 - brands with the potential to become global icons.

Lyre's Spirit Co is greatly honoured to be recognised in this unranked listing alongside incredible brands and businesses such as Airtasker, Airwallex, Go1, Linktree, Go-To Skincare Pty Ltd, Heaps Normal, Sharesies and The Oodie.

Interbrand's Ash Stapleton, Senior Strategist commented: “There are plenty of other brands creating non-alcoholic spirits or alternatives, but Lyre’s truly stands out. They’ve crafted their product with as much care as the alcoholic spirits they replace, they clearly value brand, and their growth is astounding in just two short (pandemic-filled) years.”

awards.title: International Spirits Challenge - 2021
awards.description:
Lyre's Spirit Co received this renowned competition’s only gold medal in the non-alcoholic spirits category.

Delighted by the recognition for our Amalfi Spritz RTD product, and the other 10 silver medals our range collected.

profile_positions.description:
Many years in the making, Lyre’s exquisite range of lovingly crafted alcohol-free, classic spirits was borne from a quest to make the impossible possible. To provide an alternative to those who don’t wish to imbibe alcohol, but still wish to enjoy the mirth, merriment and social intercourse of an evening soiree or shindig. 

But this is not just any alternative. 

Every Lyre’s spirit looks, tastes and sashays around the palate just like the original. And yet, the absence of giggle juice enables revellers to remain clear-headed, of good cheer and in fine fettle to pursue whatever tickles their fancy the following day.  

Lyre’s – the finest range of non-alcoholic classic spirits the world has ever seen.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
BrandLink is a technology-focussed fulfilment business, specialising in the needs of the FMCG industry.  We enable promotional fulfilment, direct to consumer sampling and eCommerce.
 
We help global brands execute promotional campaigns using class-leading software that we've built in house, from scratch.
 
Our technology delivers for our clients unprecedented transparency, granularity in spend and significant cost-out.  We have developed proprietary algorithms to help our teams optimize shipments in the most economical way possible.  We leverage our scale and knowledge of logistics together with campaign modelling to ensure our clients are quoted up front prior to campaigns commencing - a feature unique to BrandLink.
 
Finally, we are investing heavily in automation and robotics, the like of which has usually only been seen in enterprise-scale fulfilment providers.  This gives our business a technological edge and allows our business to respond to the demands of our clients with best in class speed, accuracy and cost.

In 2018, BrandLink was recognised as the Transport & Logistics Business of the year in the Optus myBusiness Awards.

After years of sustained, high growth, BrandLink has been recognised in the Australian Financial Review Fast 100 list in 2016, 2017 & 2018 and is a recipient of six Deloitte Tech Awards over 2017, 2018 & 2019, placing 18th, 14th & 49th in the Australian Tech 50 and 147th, 166th and 385th in the Deloitte Technology Fast 500 Asia Pacific.  BrandLink also received a SmartCompany Smart50 award in 2017 & 2018, placing 8th and 4th in the respective years.

profile_positions.description:
Mandalay Venture Partners invests in companies that provide high potential for impact, sustainability, and capital returns across the agricultural, supply chain and the wider food value-add sectors. We are deeply passionate about early stage innovation and are on a bigger mission to contribute to global food security and sustainability.

Our ‘sleeves-up capital’ approach and innovation platform are built on the proven, multi-decade business growth and investment returns of the team. Mandalay Venture Partners consists of agrifood and technology entrepreneurs with a global track record of opportunity assessment, venture building, acceleration, market development and portfolio management. We approach early stage investing through active engagement guiding ventures through growth to capitalise on commercial opportunities and market outcomes.

We’re seeking to connect with amazing people doing remarkable things that can globally redefine agrifood technology.
profile_positions.title: Venture Partner

profile_positions.description:
FUL® comes from Spirulina, a blue-green algae long embraced as a powerful source of nutrition. Before FUL® found its way into your refreshing drink, its ancestors helped give rise to life on earth billions of years ago.

FUL® has been pioneered by a team of leading food scientists and passionate climate supporters who have figured out a highly sustainable process to extract Spirulina's rich nutrients... without the *strong* taste.

True to its life-enabling roots, FUL® belongs to a new category of food - “climate positive.” We consider the climate to encompass the earth and its life forms, which we strive to proactively benefit through FUL®'s product properties and the way it is produced.

The Queensland Olympic Council (QOC) operates as the state office of the Australian Olympic Committee (AOC). The QOC’s aim is to project the AOC’s commitment to spread and maintain the ideals of Olympism and the Olympic Movement through education and the development of Queensland based Australian athletes, encouraging both high performance sport and sport for all.

The QOC’s main objective is to provide both Queensland and Australian athletes, with the best possible opportunity to reach their highest potential and to achieve the ultimate goal of representing Australia with distinction at the world's most prestigious sports festival, the Olympic Games.
Aussie Founders Network is a Public Benefit Corporation that helps founders with an Australian (and NZ) connection to build more successful and prosperous businesses, globally.

volunteer_experiences.role: Industry Advisory Board Member - Design Vertical
volunteer_experiences.description: The Torrens University Industry Advisory Board ensures close ties and regular dialogue between industry stakeholders and TUA academic staff.  As an industry stakeholder, I contribute to ensuring graduates have relevant skill sets, closely aligned with industry requirements through continual improvement of the quality and relevance of the TUA courses and curriculum within the Design Vertical.

I've worked closely with three startup intakes (over 30+ startups) in the River City Labs accelerator, helping them understand and focus on the importance of branding and connecting with their customers, and how this shapes their communication and strategy.  

I've continued to mentor and have invested in some of the startups met through the program, and helped them connect with investors, enterprise and relevant government agencies.

I worked closely with the Coterie of 10 startups in the QUE CEA Collider Accelerator, working through the first principles of branding, marketing and positioning and how this needs to shape their marketing and communication strategies.
